title: Finding the Determinant
text: The determinant is given by $$a d-b c$$, which evaluates to $$(-32-15)$$, or $$-47$$.
speech: The determinant is given by  a d minus b c , which evaluates to , parentheses, negative 32 minus 15,  , or  negative 47 .
pacedSpeech: The determinant is given by   a d minus b c

title: Multiplying the Determinant with the Changed Matrix
text: We must modify the matrix into the form $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}$$. We now have $$\begin{bmatrix} 8 & 3 \\ 5 & -4 \end{bmatrix}$$. Dividing this by the determinant gives us $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{-8}{47} & \frac{3}{47} \\ \frac{5}{47} & \frac{-4}{47} \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: We must modify the matrix into the form  the 2 by 2 matrix row 1 d, negative b row 2 negative c, a . We now have , the 2 by 2 matrix row 1 8, 3 row 2 5, negative 4 . Dividing this by the determinant gives us  the 2 by 2 matrix row 1 column 1 fraction, negative 8, over 47,  column 2 3 over 47 row 2 column 1 5 over 47 column 2 fraction, negative 4, over 47,
